p: The municipalities of the state of Amazonas were found to have medium current vulnerability; the average value of the Vulnerability Index (VInd) was 0.406. It is clear that the VInd was very heterogeneous throughout the state, with the central portion being the least vulnerable (lower VInd), while most of the southern, northern, and eastern regions, including some municipalities of the metropolitan region of Manaus, had higher VInd scores ( Fig 5). The microregions of Purus, Manaus and Boca do Acre possessed the highest (> 0.560) average values of current vulnerability.
